intro: Pterostylis erythroconcha, commonly known as the red-veined helmet-orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its unique, helmet-shaped flower with a red-veined labellum, which is a specialized structure that aids in pollination. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Its flowering period occurs during the cooler months, usually from late autumn to early spring. The species is part of the Orchidaceae family and exhibits complex interactions with specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
